item.title: Node Allocation
item.description: The HPC Linux computing resource consists of a total 16 compute nodes in one cluster. The charts below describe the various Linux computing partitions available on HPC, their names, and information on the partitionsâ€™ computing power. General Computing Partitions and Nodes These are general nodes available to all HPC researchers: Partition Names Node Range # of Nodes Mem size Cores per Node CPU Speed GHz CPU Type GPUs per Node /tmp Size low node1 ~ node6 6 125 G 24 2.
